string.name: introduction_paragraph_first_a
string.value: Oxford, meaning "Ford of the Oxen", is a major city in the Thames Valley of England. The University of Oxford is the oldest university in the English-speaking world.

string.name: introduction_paragraph_second_a
string.value: Zone A gets inspiration from the grandeur of Oxford University. With gray stone and steeples, pale limestone exteriors, and neat lawns in courtyards surrounded by colonnades, this Zone truly embodies the scholarship of the world-class university.

string.name: introduction_paragraph_first_b
string.value: Bruges is located in northwestern Belgium, famous as a medieval city and full of rivers and canals, enabling visitors to enjoy the view of the water city on boat.

string.name: introduction_paragraph_second_b
string.value: Zone B is modeled after Bruges and thus features quaint buildings. The red bricks and stepped gable roofs are combined with the bell towers and arched stone bridges, creating a naturally harmonious space.

string.name: introduction_paragraph_first_c
string.value: Luxembourg is often referred to as "a land of castles" for its many castles, possessing diverse terrain and a strategic location. Though pocket-size, the country is highly-developed.

string.name: introduction_paragraph_second_c
string.value: Zone C draws upon Luxembourg's beautiful stone walls and natural cliffs. It reproduces the high and low terrain of Luxembourg, as well as the country's captivating combination of streets and alleys, recreating a fairytale-like town.

string.name: introduction_paragraph_first_d
string.value: Located in North West England, Windermere is England's largest natural lake and a major part of the Lake District National Park. It is a popular tourist destination that boasts yachting in the summer.

string.name: introduction_paragraph_second_d
string.value: Zone D is modeled after Windermere, where mountains merge with a large lake. Here, a lawn extends along the lake shore and beautiful stone walls, giving the area an idyllic feel.

string.name: introduction_paragraph_first_e
string.value: Granada is located at the foot of the Sierra Nevada mountains. As the capital of the last Arab-ruled state in the Iberian Peninsula, it also has the architectural treasures of the Christian Renaissance period, featuring Muslim and Mediterranean styles.

string.name: introduction_paragraph_second_e
string.value: Zone E draws on the architectural style of the exquisite Alhambra in Granada. The blocks and streets in this zone is characterized by a unique Spanish style, with a combination of eastern and western charm.

string.name: introduction_paragraph_first_f
string.value: Paris, the capital and largest city of France, is also one of the world's five major international metropolises. As the "City of Romance," Paris has a history of more than 1400 years, located in the central part of the Paris Basin and across the Seine River.

string.name: introduction_paragraph_second_f
string.value: Zone F, inspired by the International University City of Paris, highlights the elegance and exquisiteness of French architecture with elaborate furnishings, French convex windows, and beige limestone.

string.name: introduction_paragraph_first_g
string.value: Verona is one of the oldest and most beautiful cities in Italy, and the second largest city after Venice. It is not only famous for Verona marble but also known as the city of love, because it is the hometown of Shakespeare's Romeo and Juliet.

string.name: introduction_paragraph_second_g
string.value: Zone G with Italian style is our only campus block that is surrounded by water, making it similar to the Floating City of Venice. The 7 bridges here conjure up the feeling of the ancient Verona.

string.name: introduction_paragraph_first_h
string.value: Český Krumlov is a small town in the Czech Republic, known as the most beautiful ancient town in Europe. It was listed as a World Cultural and Natural Heritage by UNESCO in 1992.

string.name: introduction_paragraph_second_h
string.value: Zone H reproduces the architectural features of castles, churches, and monasteries in Český Krumlov, with a beautiful winding river running through the area, making it a pleasant space for a walk.

string.name: introduction_paragraph_first_j
string.value: Fribourg is on the cultural border between German-speaking and French-speaking Switzerland. The Gothic architecture bestows upon it an unparalleled charm, with some of the best-preserved stone-paved paths and Catholic churches in Switzerland.

string.name: introduction_paragraph_second_j
string.value: Zone J draws on the medieval style of Fribourg, featuring the light-colored architecture with white walls and red tiles, combined with the characteristics of ancient city, creating a beautiful landscape alongside the lake.

string.name: introduction_paragraph_first_k
string.value: Burgundy, located in southern Paris, is a world-famous wine production region with abundant sunshine, producing rich red wines and dry white wines with low tannin and alcohol and moderately high acidity.

string.name: introduction_paragraph_second_k
string.value: Zone K, modeled after Burgundy, has a unique architectural landscape reshaped from Abbey of Fontenay and Semur-en-Auxois, which features the brown-red roof.

string.name: introduction_paragraph_first_l
string.value: Heidelberg is a vibrant city in Germany with a unique blend of tradition and modernity, having the reddish-brown ancient castle as the landmark. The University of Heidelberg, where the thinker Hegel studied and worked, is one of the oldest educational institutions in Europe.

string.name: introduction_paragraph_second_l
string.value: Zone L has ancient-style Heidelberg buildings with white walls and red tiles, referencing the design idea of the University of Heidelberg, which boasts renown in human sciences with a long history. The delicate and magnificent castle stands on the hills, in sharp contrast to the surrounding grid-like roads.

string.name: introduction_paragraph_first_m
string.value: Bologna is a famous historical and cultural city in northern Italy. It is often listed as one of the most promising cities because of its significant industrial tradition and advanced social welfare. Colonnades are ubiquitous, with medieval, Gothic, Renaissance, and heavy Baroque features.

string.name: introduction_paragraph_second_m
string.value: Zone M draws inspiration from Bologna, the city of colonnades, integrating ancient architectural features such as towers, Renaissance palaces, and Gothic churches. You can walk in the corridors to take shelter from the sun and rain.

string.name: area_sub_name_l
string.value: A renowned ancient and cultural city
